methods.name: bigquery
methods.description: Analyze Big Data in the cloud with Google BigQuery. Run fast, SQL-like queries against multi-terabyte datasets in seconds. Scalable and easy to use, BigQuery gives you real-time insights about your data.

methods.name: datastore
methods.description: Google Cloud Datastore is a fully managed, schemaless database for storing non-relational data. Use this object to create a Dataset to interact with your data, an "Int", and a "Double" representation.

methods.name: dns
methods.description: Google Cloud DNS is a high-performance, resilient, global DNS service that provides a cost- effective way to make your applications and services available to your users. This programmable, authoritative DNS service can be used to easily publish and manage DNS records using the same infrastructure relied upon by Google.

methods.name: pubsub
methods.description: Google Cloud Pub/Sub is a reliable, many-to-many, asynchronous messaging service from Google Cloud Platform.

methods.name: search
methods.description:
Google Cloud Search allows you to quickly perform full-text and geospatial searches against your data without having to spin up your own instances and without the hassle of managing and maintaining a search service.

This is an Alpha release of Google Cloud Search. This feature is not covered by any SLA or deprecation policy and may be subject to backward-incompatible changes.

methods.name: storage
methods.description: Google Cloud Storage allows you to store data on Google infrastructure. Read Google Cloud Storage API docs for more information.

methods.name: gcloud
methods.description:
There are two key ways to use the gcloud module.

  1. Provide connection & configuration details up-front.

  2. Provide them at the time of instantiation of sub-modules, e.g. a Datastore dataset, a Cloud Storage bucket, etc.

See our Authorization Guide for how to obtain the necessary credentials for connecting to your project.

examples.caption: From the same authentication credentials, you may now access your Google Cloud Storage buckets, for example.
examples.code:
var gcs = gcloud.storage();
var bucket = gcs.bucket('photos');

examples.caption: However, if you need to override the global credentials, you may provide new ones.
gcs and otherGcs will use their respective credentials for all future API requests.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: • The project ID from the Google Developer's Console. E.g. 'purple-grape-123'.

params.name: config.keyFilename
params.description: • Full path to the a .json, .pem, or .p12 key downloaded from the Google Developers Console. NOTE: .pem and .p12 require you to specify config.email as well.

params.name: config.email
params.description: • Account email address. Required when using a .pem or .p12 keyFilename.

params.name: config.autoRetry
params.description: • Automatically retry requests if the response is related to rate limits or certain intermittent server errors. We will exponentially backoff subsequent requests by default. (default: true)

params.name: config.maxRetries
params.description: • Maximum number of automatic retries attempted before returning the error. (default: 3)
